name: A'kale'a Quackers
description:
Pun totally intended (; 
I have a Doctorate in Chiropractic for those who don't know me yet...

Get it now?  "Quackers"  hahahaha (:  
I 'CRACK' myself up! hahahaha !!!
Oh man, the puns are endless...'sigh'...'tear swipe'...'flick'...
Enjoy this 'spine tingling' recipe....ok...I'll stop.....

For Full Recipe Scan QR Code

Recipe & Photos By: Dr. Akala Lemus, D.C.
9/16/2018

Ingredients: 
pulp from 1 head of kale 
1/4 c flax meal
1/4 c chis seeds
1/3 c nutritional yeast
1/4 tsp salt and pepper
1/4 tsp cumin
1/2 tsp turmeric
1/4 c water 


Method:

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F

2. Use a food processor to blend all ingredients until well combined. Use a spatula to scrape down the sides to make sure everything is well incorporated. 

3. Place mixture on a baking sheet - I used a silpat nonstick baking mat to help with flipping and avoiding any issues with sticking. 

4. Use a baking spatula, or your hands to flatten cracker to desired thickness. ~1/4" thick is what I typically do.

5. Use a pizza cutter or a sharp knife (be careful not to cut your silpat if using one!) to cut into desired size and shape crackers.

6. At ~1/4" thickness bake for 10 min and then, flip and cook for another ~25 min. See pictures in recipe using QR code.

Checking periodically until you reach your desired texture- removing the crisped 'quackers' as they bake to avoid over cooking them. 
NOTE*** Using a dehydrator is a great option, if you have one!

Serve them up with any dish you would like to add a side of crunch with! 

In my opinion, these are the best served straight out of the oven. They are not very good the next day as they get a bit soft because of the chia seeds. The thinner they are the more potential they have for being good crunchy 'leftovers.' I juice every day so I have fresh pulp to make new ones as desired.
